programmes.show_description: Nathan Shepherd selects his fave grunge hits by Nirvana, L7, Dinosaur Jr and loads more.
Mark Lamarr with a series chronicling the history and development of reggae music.
Mark Lamarr with a series chronicling the history of reggae music. Tonight's guest is Alton Ellis.
A rare BBC session by Them, live sets from Del Amitri and C. Duncan, and Winston Reedy in concert from 1985.
Want to hear the latest tracks 6 Music have added to their playlist? Then listen here!
Names in Songs returns, can you hear your name in a well-known song?
Photographer and filmmaker Aidan Zamiri discusses his directorial debut, The Moment, starring Charli xcx.
Lauren gets your Wednesday going with the most magnificent music.
Craig celebrates your midweek wins for Wednesday, I'm In Love, and we hear another of your left-field music suggestions as we turn Left At The Lights.
Alexis and Green join Huw to talk collaborating on Alexis' new album 'Paris In Spring'. We'll also get to know London art-rock outfit Modern Woman in this weeks 'Huw Are You'.
Deb chats to Shabaka Hutchings about the music that has influenced his career, ahead of the release of his album Of The Earth.
Marc Riley and Gideon Coe are joined by Stereolab for tonight's session - super excited!
3/4. 6 Music Festival 2026 headliners The Horrors celebrate women in post-punk.
Newcastle accordion and drums duo ATFK aka Amy Thatcher and Francesca Knowles choose an hour of music where acoustic meets electronic.
Recorded in Los Angeles Ralph Johnson's selection of the finest Jazz from the 60's & 70's.
Featuring selections from Miles Davis, Freddie Hubbard, Oliver Nelson and Shirley Horn.
It's back to 1990 and King George's Hall in Blackburn for an early Charlatans gig, and there are BBC sessions from Pink Kross and The Mauskovic Dance Band.
Soundtrack the early hours with back to back music, plus exclusive BBC sessions.
Chris Hawkins fires up Thursday with the biggest tunes and future classics.
DJ, producer and artist Honey Dijon chats to Nick and shares her new music.
Lauren's got the finest music to motivate your Thursday, with the best tunes old and new.
Comedian and writer Lucy Beaumont joins Craig to chat about her upcoming tour 'Bad At Quiz Shows, Good With Weirdos'.
Huw has handpicked music, old and new, plus we round up the gigs, shows and festivals that everybody is talking about in today's Gig Lisztomania.
Chilli Jesson from Dead Dads Club, DJ and producer Anish Kumar and presenter Tara Kumar join Huw on his weekly Roundtable to review the latest music releases.
Start your weekend early with a mix from KAVARI, who is also this week's Breaking Artist, known for her genre defying, hard hitting productions.
Gideon Coe with his music loves from every era and genre.
4/4. 6 Music Festival 2026 headliners The Horrors share some of their favourite new artists.
